column6: Food Animal Production, Management, and Evaluation
column7: Provides an overview of how nutrition, genetics, and environment affect beef cattle, swine, and sheep growth, development, and end-product quality and value. Students get hands-on experience evaluating and determining value of live animals and carcasses. Prerequisite: Credit or concurrent enrollment in ANSC 223 and ANSC 224; or consent of instructor.
column9: Prerequisite: Credit or concurrent enrollment in ANSC 223 and ANSC 224; or consent of instructor.
